channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Massive Pothole, 18th January
item.description:
Massive pothole that literally takes up the entire side of the road over the bus stop along Gloucester Rd. Causes a lot of traffic in rush hour as everyone slows down to go over it slowly as it is so large. Will damage a car if left needs sorting asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 23 Campden Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe Pavement, 18th January
item.description:
The wall has been removed alongside this narrow bit of pavement, leaving a significant drop. Additionally the remaining pavement is now so narrow that prams and similar struggle to pass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Broadway Road, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another Flytip and Smouldering Fire at Location - repeated, 18th January
item.description:
The location is the entrance and behind the wall on the footpath, to the Old Quarry off the Cleeve Common Road. A small flytip here was reported a few days ago and has now been added to together with a fire. The tip consists of car parts, christmas decorations and NAILS on the car parking bit. Please can this be cleared up as soon as possible especially the nails and especially behind the entrance wall where the fire is.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cleeve Common, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding / Failure to drain water away, 18th January
item.description:
While a bit late but necessary as it will re-occur - during the recent heavy rain the road was covered with water to a depth of 12 to 18inches. It clearly was not draining away and as this problem is /was on a mix of blind bend, right turns and narrowing road, trafic forced to take avoiding action was on the wrong side of the road. Although it is acknowledged that previous work has been carried out to try to alleviate what has been an ongoing problem - what ever remedy was supposedly put in place clearly failed especially when a lot of rain falls. Water was just NOT draining away. Please can this problem be revisted and something done to permanently stop it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Turnpike House Greenway Lane, Battledown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Sweep Required, 17th January
item.description:
This road through Elkstone Village needs a sweep, it is full of debris which blocks up the drains. All the water off the main road comes into the village as there are no drains on the main road. The village drains are blocked up with debris. The whole road needs a sweep
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone
Report on FixMyStreet
